title: Rashi on Amos
text: Who was in (the) Nokdim: And Targum Yonatan translates it as: "Master of Sheep", just as Mesha, the King of Moab, was a "Noked" (Melachim 2, 3).

Two years before the earthquake: Two years before King Uzziah died, on the day that Isaiah (Isaiah 6) prophesied "And the foundations shall be shaken." It is referenced by Zechariah (Zechariah 14) when he says "Just as you had fled from the earthquake."
Shall roar from Zion – communication comes out from the Holy of Holies:
swore by Himself – consciously and with intention:

I abhor – This means abhor (even though it is written with an aleph and not an ayin.) This is how Yonatan translated it into Aramaic ‘I despise the great Holy Temple of Yaakov.’ He calls it this because the Temple is called the pride of their strength, as it says “Behold I am profaning My sanctuary, the pride of your strength…” (Ezekiel 24:21):
the city and the fullness thereof  - Jerusalem and its inhabitants:
אמציה said that Amos said Jeroboam will die by swords but really he didn't say his son was the one who died
Quotes Targum. 1 of the 10 steps of Hashem leaving the Beit Hamikdash.
